an4.207:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you who’s bad and who’s worse,

an4.207:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti …pe… micchādiṭṭhiko hoti.
an4.207:2.2.eng: It’s someone who kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re covetous, malicious, with wrong view.

an4.207:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca pāṇātipātī hoti, parañca pāṇātipāte samādapeti …pe… attanā ca micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, parañca micchādiṭṭhiyā samādapeti.
an4.207:3.2.eng: It’s someone who kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. They’re covetous, malicious, with wrong view. And they encourage others to do these things.

an4.207:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhiko hoti.
an4.207:4.2.eng: It’s someone who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, or commit sexual misconduct. They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re contented, kind-hearted, with right view.

an4.207:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, parañca pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti …pe… attanā ca sammādiṭṭhiko hoti, parañca sammādiṭṭhiyā samādapeti.
an4.207:5.2.eng: It’s someone who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, or commit sexual misconduct. They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. They’re contented, kind-hearted, with right view. And they encourage others to do these things.

an4.208:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you who’s bad and who’s worse,

an4.208:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco micchādiṭṭhiko hoti …pe… micchāñāṇī hoti, micchāvimutti hoti.
an4.208:2.2.eng: It’s someone who has wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.

an4.208:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, parañca micchādiṭṭhiyā samādapeti …pe… attanā ca micchāñāṇī hoti, parañca micchāñāṇe samādapeti;
an4.208:3.2.eng: It’s someone who has wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom. And they encourage others in these same qualities.

an4.208:3.3.pli: attanā ca micchāvimutti hoti, parañca micchāvimuttiyā samādapeti.

an4.208:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco sammādiṭṭhiko hoti …pe… sammāñāṇī hoti, sammāvimutti hoti.
an4.208:4.2.eng: It’s someone who has right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an4.208:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca sammādiṭṭhiko hoti, parañca sammādiṭṭhiyā samādapeti …pe… attanā ca sammāñāṇī hoti, parañca sammāñāṇe samādapeti;
an4.208:5.2.eng: It’s someone who has right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom. And they encourage others in these same qualities.

an4.208:5.3.pli: attanā ca sammāvimutti hoti, parañca sammāvimuttiyā samādapeti.

an4.21:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
an4.21:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

an4.21:1.3.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

an4.21:2.1.pli: “Ekamidāhaṃ, bhikkhave, samayaṃ uruvelāyaṃ viharāmi najjā nerañjarāya tīre ajapālanigrodhe paṭhamābhisambuddho.
an4.21:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, this one time, when I was first awakened, I was staying in Uruvelā at the goatherd’s banyan tree on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.

an4.21:2.2.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
an4.21:2.2.eng: As I was in private retreat this thought came to mind:

an4.21:2.3.eng: ‘One without respect and reverence lives in suffering.

an4.21:2.4.pli: Kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyan’ti?
an4.21:2.4.eng: What ascetic or brahmin should I honor and respect and rely on?’

an4.21:3.2.pli: ‘aparipūrassa kho ahaṃ sīlakkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṃ.
an4.21:3.2.eng: ‘I would honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entire spectrum of ethics, if it were incomplete.

an4.21:3.3.pli: Na kho panāhaṃ passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya aññaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā attanā sīlasampannataraṃ, yamahaṃ sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṃ.
an4.21:3.3.eng: But I don’t see any other ascetic or brahmin in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Divinities, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who is more accomplished than myself in ethics, who I should honor and respect and rely on.

an4.21:4.1.pli: Aparipūrassa kho ahaṃ samādhikkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṃ.
an4.21:4.1.eng: I would honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entire spectrum of immersion, if it were incomplete.

an4.21:4.2.pli: Na kho panāhaṃ passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya aññaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā attanā samādhisampannataraṃ, yamahaṃ sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṃ.
an4.21:4.2.eng: But I don’t see any other ascetic or brahmin … who is more accomplished than myself in immersion …

an4.21:5.1.pli: Aparipūrassa kho ahaṃ paññākkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṃ.
an4.21:5.1.eng: I would honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entrie spectrum of wisdom, if it were incomplete.

an4.21:5.2.pli: Na kho panāhaṃ passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya aññaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā attanā paññāsampannataraṃ, yamahaṃ sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṃ.
an4.21:5.2.eng: But I don’t see any other ascetic or brahmin in this world … who is more accomplished than myself in wisdom …

an4.21:6.1.pli: Aparipūrassa kho ahaṃ vimuttikkhandhassa pāripūriyā aññaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyaṃ.
an4.21:6.1.eng: I would honor and respect and rely on another ascetic or brahmin so as to complete the entire spectrum of freedom, if it were incomplete.

an4.21:6.2.pli: Na kho panāhaṃ passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya aññaṃ samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā attanā vimuttisampannataraṃ, yamahaṃ sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyan’ti.
an4.21:6.2.eng: But I don’t see any other ascetic or brahmin in this world … who is more accomplished than myself in freedom …’

an4.21:7.2.pli: ‘yannūnāhaṃ yvāyaṃ dhammo mayā abhisambuddho tameva dhammaṃ sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihareyyan’ti.
an4.21:7.2.eng: ‘Why don’t I honor and respect and rely on the same teaching to which I was awakened?’

an4.21:8.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmā sahampati mama cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evamevaṃ—brahmaloke antarahito mama purato pāturahosi.
an4.21:8.1.eng: And then the divinity Sahampati, knowing my train of thought, vanished from the realm of divinity and appeared in front of me, as easily as a strong man would extend or contract his arm.

an4.21:8.2.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmā sahampati ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā dakkhiṇaṃ jāṇumaṇḍalaṃ pathaviyaṃ nihantvā yenāhaṃ tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā maṃ etadavoca:
an4.21:8.2.eng: He arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward me, and said:

an4.21:8.3.eng: ‘That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!

an4.21:8.4.pli: Yepi te, bhante, ahesuṃ atītamaddhānaṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā tepi bhagavanto dhammaṃyeva sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihariṃsu;
an4.21:8.4.eng: All the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas who lived in the past honored and respected and relied on this same teaching.

an4.21:8.5.pli: yepi te, bhante, bhavissanti anāgatamaddhānaṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā tepi bhagavanto dhammaṃyeva sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya viharissanti;
an4.21:8.5.eng: All the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas who will live in the future will honor and respect and rely on this same teaching.

an4.21:8.6.pli: bhagavāpi, bhante, etarahi arahaṃ sammāsambuddho dhammaṃyeva sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya viharatū’ti.
an4.21:8.6.eng: May the Blessed One, who is the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha at present, also honor and respect and rely on this same teaching.’

an4.21:8.7.eng: That’s what the divinity Sahampati said.

an4.21:8.8.eng: Then he went on to say:

an4.21:9.4.eng: destroyer of the sorrows of many—

an4.21:10.2.eng: they did live, they do live,

an4.21:10.4.eng: This is the nature of the Buddhas.

an4.21:11.4.eng: remembering the instructions of the Buddhas.’

an4.21:12.1.eng: That’s what the divinity Sahampati said.

an4.21:12.2.pli: Idaṃ vatvā maṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
an4.21:12.2.eng: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.

an4.21:12.3.pli: Atha khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmuno ca ajjhesanaṃ viditvā attano ca patirūpaṃ yvāyaṃ dhammo mayā abhisambuddho tameva dhammaṃ sakkatvā garuṃ katvā upanissāya vihāsiṃ.
an4.21:12.3.eng: Then, knowing the request of the Divinity and what was suitable for myself, I honored and respected and relied on the same teaching to which I was awakened.

an4.21:12.4.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, saṅghopi mahattena samannāgato, atha me saṅghepi gāravo”ti.
an4.21:12.4.eng: And since the Saṅgha has also achieved greatness, I also respect the Saṅgha.”

an4.210:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you bad character and worse character,

an4.210:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco micchādiṭṭhiko hoti …pe… micchāñāṇī hoti, micchāvimutti hoti.
an4.210:2.2.eng: It’s someone who has wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.

an4.210:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, parañca micchādiṭṭhiyā samādapeti …pe… attanā ca micchāñāṇī hoti, parañca micchāñāṇe samādapeti;
an4.210:3.2.eng: It’s someone who has wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom. And they encourage others in these same qualities.

an4.210:3.3.pli: attanā ca micchāvimutti hoti, parañca micchāvimuttiyā samādapeti.

an4.210:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco sammādiṭṭhiko hoti …pe… sammāñāṇī hoti, sammāvimutti hoti.
an4.210:4.2.eng: It’s someone who has right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an4.210:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca sammādiṭṭhiko hoti, parañca sammādiṭṭhiyā samādapeti …pe… attanā ca sammāñāṇī hoti, parañca sammāñāṇe samādapeti;
an4.210:5.2.eng: It’s someone who has right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom. And they encourage others in these same qualities.

an4.210:5.3.pli: attanā ca sammāvimutti hoti, parañca sammāvimuttiyā samādapeti.

an4.211:1.3.eng: A monk, nun, layman, or laywoman who is unethical, of bad character.

an4.211:1.7.eng: These are the four that corrupt an assembly.

an4.211:2.1.eng: Mendicants, these four grace an assembly.

an4.211:2.3.eng: A monk, nun, layman, or laywoman who is ethical, of good character.

an4.211:2.7.eng: These are the four that grace an assembly.”

an4.212:1.1.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.212:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.212:1.3.eng: Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and wrong view.

an4.212:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.212:1.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.212:2.1.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an4.212:2.1.eng: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven.

an4.212:2.3.eng: Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and right view.

an4.212:2.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an4.212:2.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an4.213:1.1.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.213:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.213:1.3.eng: Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and being ungrateful and thankless.

an4.213:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.213:1.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.213:2.1.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an4.213:2.1.eng: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven.

an4.213:2.3.eng: Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and being grateful and thankful.

an4.213:2.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an4.213:2.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an4.214:1.1.pli: …pe… Pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti …pe… pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti.
an4.214:1.1.eng: “Someone with four qualities is cast down to hell. … They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, and lie. … Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. … They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or lie. …”

an4.215:1.1.pli: …pe… Micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, micchāsaṅkappo hoti, micchāvāco hoti, micchākammanto hoti …pe… sammādiṭṭhiko hoti, sammāsaṅkappo hoti, sammāvāco hoti, sammākammanto hoti.
an4.215:1.1.eng: “Someone with four qualities is cast down to hell. … wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action. … Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. … right view, right thought, right speech, right action. …”

an4.216:1.1.pli: …pe… Micchāājīvo hoti, micchāvāyāmo hoti, micchāsati hoti, micchāsamādhi hoti …pe… sammāājīvo hoti, sammāvāyāmo hoti, sammāsati hoti, sammāsamādhi hoti.
an4.216:1.1.eng: “Someone with four qualities is cast down to hell. … wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong immersion. Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. … right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion. …”

an4.217:1.1.pli: …pe… Adiṭṭhe diṭṭhavādī hoti, asute sutavādī hoti, amute mutavādī hoti, aviññāte viññātavādī hoti …pe… adiṭṭhe adiṭṭhavādī hoti, asute asutavādī hoti, amute amutavādī hoti, aviññāte aviññātavādī hoti.
an4.217:1.1.eng: “Someone with four qualities is cast down to hell. … They say they’ve seen, heard, thought, or known something, but they haven’t. … Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. … They say they haven’t seen, heard, thought, or known something, and they haven’t. …”

an4.218:1.1.pli: …pe… Diṭṭhe adiṭṭhavādī hoti, sute asutavādī hoti, mute amutavādī hoti, viññāte aviññātavādī hoti …pe… diṭṭhe diṭṭhavādī hoti, sute sutavādī hoti, mute mutavādī hoti, viññāte viññātavādī hoti.
an4.218:1.1.eng: “Someone with four qualities is cast down to hell. … They say they haven’t seen, heard, thought, or known something, but they have. … Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. … They say they’ve seen, heard, thought, or known something, and they have. …”

an4.219:1.1.pli: …pe… Assaddho hoti, dussīlo hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti …pe… saddho hoti, sīlavā hoti, hirimā hoti, ottappī hoti.
an4.219:1.1.eng: “Someone with four qualities is cast down to hell. … They’re faithless, unethical, shameless, and imprudent. … Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven. … They’re faithful, ethical, conscientious, and prudent. …”

an4.22:1.1.pli: “Ekamidāhaṃ, bhikkhave, samayaṃ uruvelāyaṃ viharāmi najjā nerañjarāya tīre ajapālanigrodhe paṭhamābhisambuddho.
an4.22:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, this one time, when I was first awakened, I was staying in Uruvelā at the goatherd’s banyan tree on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.

an4.22:1.2.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, sambahulā brāhmaṇā jiṇṇā vuddhā mahallakā addhagatā vayoanuppattā yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā mayā saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
an4.22:1.2.eng: Then several old brahmins—elderly and senior, who were advanced in years and had reached the final stage of life—came up to me, and exchanged greetings with me.

an4.22:1.3.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho, bhikkhave, te brāhmaṇā maṃ etadavocuṃ:
an4.22:1.3.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side, and said to me:

an4.22:1.5.pli: “na samaṇo gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuddhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimantetī”ti.
an4.22:1.5.eng: “The ascetic Gotama does not bow to old brahmins, elderly and senior, who are advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; nor does he rise in their presence or offer them a seat.”

an4.22:1.6.eng: And this is indeed the case,

an4.22:1.7.pli: Na hi bhavaṃ gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuddhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti.
an4.22:1.7.eng: for the worthy Gotama does not bow to old brahmins, elderly and senior, who are advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; nor does he rise in their presence or offer them a seat.

an4.22:1.8.eng: This is not appropriate, worthy Gotama.’

an4.22:2.2.pli: ‘nayime āyasmanto jānanti theraṃ vā therakaraṇe vā dhamme’ti.
an4.22:2.2.eng: ‘These venerables don’t know what a senior is, or what qualities make you a senior.’

an4.22:2.3.pli: Vuddho cepi, bhikkhave, hoti āsītiko vā nāvutiko vā vassasatiko vā jātiyā.
an4.22:2.3.eng: Mendicants, suppose you’re eighty, ninety, or a hundred years old.

an4.22:2.4.pli: So ca hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī, anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.
an4.22:2.4.eng: But your speech is untimely, false, meaningless, and against the teaching or training. You say things at the wrong time which are worthless, unreasonable, rambling, and unbeneficial.

an4.22:2.5.pli: Atha kho so ‘bālo thero’tveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
an4.22:2.5.eng: Then you’ll be reckoned a ‘childish senior’.

an4.22:3.1.pli: Daharo cepi, bhikkhave, hoti yuvā susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā.
an4.22:3.1.eng: Now suppose you’re a youth, young, with pristine black hair, blessed with youth, in the prime of life.

an4.22:3.2.pli: So ca hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ.
an4.22:3.2.eng: But your speech is timely, true, meaningful, and in line with the teaching and training. You say things at the right time which are valuable, reasonable, succinct, and beneficial.

an4.22:3.3.pli: Atha kho so ‘paṇḍito thero’tveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
an4.22:3.3.eng: Then you’ll be reckoned an ‘astute senior’.

an4.22:4.1.eng: There are these four qualities that make a senior.

an4.22:4.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
an4.22:4.3.eng: A mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and resorting for alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.

an4.22:4.4.pli: Bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
an4.22:4.4.eng: They’re very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned. These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, rehearsing them, mentally scrutinizing them, and penetrating them theoretically.

an4.22:4.5.pli: Catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an4.22:4.5.eng: They get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in this life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.

an4.22:4.6.pli: Āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an4.22:4.6.eng: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an4.22:4.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro therakaraṇā dhammāti.
an4.22:4.7.eng: These are the four qualities that make a senior.

an4.22:5.1.eng: The creature with a restless mind

an4.22:5.4.eng: and they don’t like the true teaching.

an4.22:5.5.eng: They’re far from seniority, with their bad views

an4.22:5.6.eng: and their lack of regard for others.

an4.22:6.2.eng: learned and eloquent, that wise one

an4.22:7.3.eng: they’ve given up birth and death,

an4.22:7.4.eng: and have completed the spiritual journey.

an4.22:8.1.eng: That’s who I call a senior,

an4.22:8.3.eng: With the ending of defilements, a mendicant

an4.220:1.1.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.220:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.220:1.3.pli: Assaddho hoti, dussīlo hoti, kusīto hoti, duppañño hoti—
an4.220:1.3.eng: They’re faithless, unethical, lazy, and witless.

an4.220:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.220:1.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.220:2.1.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an4.220:2.1.eng: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven.

an4.220:2.3.pli: Saddho hoti, sīlavā hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, paññavā hoti—
an4.220:2.3.eng: They’re faithful, ethical, energetic, and wise.

an4.220:2.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an4.220:2.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is raised up to heaven.”
